ALERT_NAME: Institutional collapse within the financial sector
TITLE: If crypto is incorporated into Australia’s financial system, we will be lucky to avoid contagious collapse - The Guardian
SUMMARY:
As a principal adviser to the then treasurer Wayne Swan, Jim Chalmers had a ringside seat to observe the impact of the global financial crisis on the Australian economy and financial system.
But a few days ago, Jim Chalmers made comments suggesting that Australia’s financial system will not be insulated from a crisis that seems all too likely to emerge in the next few years.
Much of the concern about the incorporation of crypto into the financial system has focused on the fact that crypto prices are highly volatile.
A combination of good luck and good management, in which Jim Chalmers played a prominent role, helped Australia avoid most of the consequences of the GFC.
If crypto is allowed to play a prominent role in our financial system, we will be counting entirely on luck to avoid a future disaster.

TITLE: China is catching up with America in quantum technology - The Economist
SUMMARY:
I n a SMALL shop in the eastern Chinese city of Hefei, one of the rarest pieces of technology in the world is on display.
The quantum computer in the showroom of Origin, a Chinese startup, looks ready to be plucked from the shelf and fired up.
Only 20 such devices are produced globally each year.
It is unclear what in Origin’s showroom is for sale, but none of it is supposed to be seen by foreigners.
During your correspondent’s visit, which was agreed on in advance, the company panicked at the sight of a foreigner, abruptly cancelled interviews and notified the police.

The Problem: The Threat Of Quantum DecryptionThe most direct impact of quantum computing on cybersecurity is its ability to undermine current encryption methods.
Quantum Computing For Cyber DefenseQuantum computing is not just a threat to cybersecurity but also a potential tool for defense.
The Growing Importance Of CollaborationAddressing the cybersecurity implications of quantum computing requires global collaboration among governments, academia, and the private sector.
Startups also play a key role, as they often pioneer specialized solutions in encryption, threat detection, and secure communication.

TITLE: How many votes did Trump get? Election results in full - The Telegraph
SUMMARY:
MethodologyData is sourced from the National Election Pool, a consortium of American news outlets which collects together voting data from across the United States.
This data is collected by reporters across the country, as well as government-run streams of results.
The data is collected at both state and county level, allowing us to explore trends at a localised level.
Calls for who has won a state is decided by the National Election Pool, not the Telegraph.
Once an election is called, the number of Electoral College Votes that state has is added to the overall tally.

TITLE: Bitcoin’s Endgame: Quantum Computing Comes For BTC - Forbes
SUMMARY:
What does quantum computing mean for bitcoin?
We’re going to take a deeper look at quantum computing and the threat it poses to bitcoin.
In short, quantum computing will certainly necessitate a change to bitcoin’s protocol within the next few years, similar to the computer upgrades triggered by Y2K.
Nonetheless, quantum computing is a threat to bitcoin that must be taken seriously, and bitcoin’s protocol will need be updated sooner than later.
Quantum computing promises breakthroughs in fields ranging from medicine to advanced materials, unlocking possibilities and innovations that we can scarcely imagine today – and we are so here for it.

Commercial real estate executive is buyer of Michael Jordan’s mansion - Chicago Tribune
SUMMARY:
A commercial real estate executive with a Lincolnwood-based firm has been revealed as the buyer who paid $9.5 million on Dec. 10 for retired Bulls superstar Michael Jordan’s massive mansion on 8.4 acres in Highland Park.
John Cooper, a general partner with Lincolnwood-based HAN Capital, on Dec. 27 told the Lincoln Journal Star newspaper in his native Nebraska that he was the buyer of Jordan’s mansion.
Public records only had revealed that the buyer was a land trust whose beneficiary could not yet be determined.
Cooper’s purchase of Jordan’s mansion brought to a close a roughly 12-year chapter in which the retired Hall of Famer had tried to sell his mansion in Highland Park.
He told the Journal Star that he is putting the finishing touches on plans for the estate — plans that he said he intends to share after the start of the year.

Footfall across UK retailers was down 4.9% year on year on Thursday, according to data from MRI Software.
Shares in some UK retailers fell on Friday, as traders digested the drop in Boxing Day footfall.
It coincided with the reopening after Boxing Day of big retailers such as John Lewis, Marks & Spencer, Next and Aldi.

TITLE: Commercial Real Estate Trends To Watch For In 2025 - Forbes
SUMMARY:
gettyThere’s no doubt commercial real estate faces significant headwinds as we look toward another year.
Office upThe office market is likely to find stability in the year ahead, with improvement coming late in 2025, CBRE reports.
CBRE sees prime office space – meaning each market’s best buildings – in shorter supply, leading to prime-office vacancy reaching pre-Covid thresholds of 8.2% by 2027.
Markets particularly affected should be San Antonio, Austin, Dallas-Fort Worth, Oklahoma City, Kansas City, Des Moines and Minneapolis, CBRE reports.
The crux of the issue is how well the office space functions for employees and for video conferencing.

TITLE: PsiQuantum plans to build one of the world’s first commercially useful quantum computers in Chicago — despite huge obstacles - Chicago Tribune
SUMMARY:
But PsiQuantum, the company planning to build in Chicago one of the world’s first commercially viable quantum computers, is taking a different path.
PsiQuantum plans for a dedicated transmission line from ComEd to provide large quantities of carbon-free power for the site.
To create its qubits, PsiQuantum plans to use silicon quantum chips and tiny units of light called photons.
This phenomenon, known as superposition, is harnessed in quantum computers to perform multiple calculations simultaneously.
Another key phenomenon, entanglement, enables quantum computers to link qubits in ways that dramatically enhance computational power and efficiency.

TITLE: Manmohan Singh: Former Indian Prime Minister dies at 92 - BBC.com
SUMMARY:
Manmohan Singh, Indian ex-PM and architect of economic reform, dies at 92Watch: Former Indian PM Manmohan Singh's life and legacyFormer Indian prime minister Manmohan Singh has died at the age of 92.
Priyanka Gandhi, the daughter of former prime minister Rajiv Gandhi and a Congress party member, said that Singh was "genuinely egalitarian, wise, strong-willed and courageous until the end".
Critics however alleged that Sonia Gandhi was the real source of power while he was prime minister, and that he was never truly in charge.
LK Advani, a senior leader in the rival BJP party, called Singh India's "weakest prime minister".
Manmohan Singh defended his record, saying his government had worked with "utmost commitment and dedication for the country and the welfare of its people".
